title: Love Island Australia's Cartier Surjan, 19, is AGAINST gay marriage
text:
Love Island's Cartier Surjan has made no secret of the fact she is a 'born-again Christian' with strong values when it comes to sex.

And the 19-year-old has confirmed her strict beliefs mean she cannot support same-sex marriage.

Cartier told New Idea that she 'doesn't believe in' gay marriage but insists she 'would never discriminate' against an LGBT person.

'I don't believe in it': Love Island Australia's Cartier Surjan (pictured) has revealed she is against same-sex marriage

'With same-sex marriage, I'm a Christian, I don't believe in it,' she told the magazine.

'[But] I'm never going to discriminate against someone and make them feel uncomfortable about themselves,' she added.

Despite her strict Pentecostal beliefs, Cartier has previously admitted on Love Island to having premarital sex.

Her views: Cartier told New Idea that she 'doesn't believe in' gay marriage but insists she 'would never discriminate' against an LGBT person

But she won't be having sex on the show, telling New Idea: 'That is not something that I would give away.'

Last week, Cartier said on Love Island that she wants to 'find a husband' and has already prepared a list of baby names.

Fans on Twitter were left stunned by her attitude, with one viewer saying that she was 'too young' to be planning a family at 19.

No longer a virgin: Despite her strict Pentecostal beliefs, Cartier has previously admitted on Love Island to having premarital sex

'Oh, [shut the f**k up], Cartier. Talking about baby names makes you sound like a bloody idiot,' another person tweeted.

Same-sex marriage was legalised in Australia in December 2017 following a voluntary postal survey.

Love Island Australia continues Monday at 8.40pm on Channel Nine
